Description: Floor and foot sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery bowl; ring foot with reserved resting surface; decoration inside: two friezes of linked palmettes with enclosed ovules between and two grooved circles at centre; underside reserved with broad band, two circles and a dot.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 25.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1809)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
